data_table.description: Clinic Exam: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, and Omni 2, Exam 2. The inclusion criteria for this dataset is at least 19 years old at Exam 1, at least one parent in the Framingham Heart Study, signed BUMC IRB consent at exam 1 for participation in the FHS Third Generation exam and participation in FHS genetic research.

variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Unique study participant identification number

variable.name: idtype
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study participant cohort identifier

variable.name: g3b0073
variable.description: Medical History-Female Reproductive History: What is the best way to describe your periods?
variable.comment: Variables G3B0073A, G3B0073B, G3B0073C, G3B0073E, G3B0073E, G3B0073F, have been consolidated into G3B0073 and deleted from the dataset.
variable.value: Period stopped due to pregnancy, breast feeding, or hormonal contraceptive (e.g.: depo-provera, progesting releasing IUD, extended release birth control pill)
Period stopped due to low body weight, heavy exercise, or due to medication or health condition such as thyroid disease, pituitary tumor, hormone imbalance, stress.
Period stopped for less than 1 year (perimenopausal)
Period stopped for 1 year or more
Period stopped, but now have periods induced by hormones.

variable.name: g3b0102
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: Do you drink any of the following beverages at least once a month: Beer
variable.comment: G3B0102 and G3B0105-G3B0106 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables.

variable.name: g3b0103
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: Do you drink any of the following beverages at least once a month: Wine
variable.comment: G3B0103 and G3B0107-G3B0108 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables.

variable.name: g3b0104
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: Do you drink any of the following beverages at least once a month: Liquor/spirits
variable.comment: G3B0104 and G3B0109-G3B0110 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables.

variable.name: g3b0105
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: What is your average number of servings in a typical week or month since your last exam over past year: Beer - per week
variable.comment: G3B0102 and G3B0105-G3B0106 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. G3B0106 has been deleted. If participant reported their number of drinks per month, then a calculation was made to convert the number of drinks/month to number of drinks per week. Use G3B0105 in place of G3B0106.

variable.name: g3b0107
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: What is your average number of servings in a typical week or month since your last exam over past year: Wine - per week
variable.comment: G3B0103 and G3B0107-G3B0108 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. G3B0108 has been deleted. If participant reported their number of drinks per month, then a calculation was made to convert the number of drinks per month to number of drinks per week. Use G3B0107 in place of G3B0108.

variable.name: g3b0109
variable.description: Medical History-Alcohol Consumption: What is your average number of servings in a typical week or month since your last exam over past year: Liquor/spirits - per week
variable.comment: G3B0104 and G3B0109-G3B0110 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. G3B0110 has been deleted. If participant reported their number of drinks per month, then a calculation was made to convert the number of drinks per month to number of drinks per week. Use G3B0109 in place of G3B0110.

variable.name: g3b0645
variable.description: SF-12 Health Survey (Standard)-Self administered: In general, would you say your health is:
variable.comment: Instructions for coding G3B0645 - G3B0657: "This questionnaire asks for your views about your health. This information will help you keep track of how you feel and how well you are able to do your usual activities. Please answer every question by marking one box. If you are unsure about how to answer a question, please give the best answer you can".

variable.name: g3b0646
variable.description: SF-12 Health Survey (Standard)-Self administered: Moderate activities, such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf
variable.comment: Instructions for coding G3B0645 - G3B0657: "This questionnaire asks for your views about your health. This information will help you keep track of how you feel and how well you are able to do your usual activities. Please answer every question by marking one box. If you are unsure about how to answer a question, please give the best answer you can". Instructions for coding G3B0646 and G3B0647: "The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much?".

variable.name: g3b0711
variable.description: Physical Activity Questionnaire-Technician administered: In the past 12 months for at least one hour total time in any month did you jog or run?
variable.comment: G3B0711-G3B0714 are related variables. See annotated form for relationship between related variables. Instructions for coding G3B0711: "Now I'll ask you about your Physical Activities. Only include the time spent actually doing the activity. For example, sitting by the pool does not count as time swimming: sitting in a chair lift does not count for skiing. First I'll ask about vigorous activities. Vigorous activities increase your heart rate, or make you sweat doing them, or make your breathe hard, or raise your body temperature. If you do an activity but not vigorously, please include it later when I ask you about other non-strenuous activities. For all estimates, round up to nearest whole number." An example of "one hour of total time" is three 20 minutes sessions.
